li.a: Parent Resource: Talking to Children about COVID-19

ul.li: What you need to know about Coronavirus¬†(Spanish Version)
Talking to Children about COVID-19¬†(Spanish Version)

p.em: Healthy habits are proven to reduce illness.¬† Please review the following tips with your students:

ul.li: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
After using the bathroom.
Before and after eating.¬†
Before touching food.
After touching garbage/trash.
After touching an animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
Wet your hands with warm running water.
Lather with soap by rubbing hands together.¬† Be sure to lather the backs of your hands, between fingers, and under your nails.¬†¬†
Wash for at least 20 seconds.¬† That is about as long as it takes to sing ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù twice.
Rinse hands well under clean, running water.
Dry your hands with a paper towel.¬†
Use paper towel to turn off the tap/sink.¬†¬†
Dispose of paper towel in garbage pail.¬†

p.em: Hand sanitizer gels should only be used when soap and water are not available.¬† Apply sanitizer gel to the palm of one hand, rub hands together, rub sanitizer gel over all surfaces of hands and fingers until hands are dry.¬† Hand sanitizing gels do NOT remove food protein/allergens.

ul.li: Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze.
If you don‚Äôt have a tissue, cough or sneeze into your elbow, not your hands.
Put your used tissues in a garbage can.
Stay home if you have a fever.

p.em: ¬†Always keep hands away from your face.¬† Avoiding touching mouth, nose, or rubbing eyes with hands.

ul.li: Start the day with a healthy breakfast. It refuels the body and provides energy for the day.
Drink plenty of fluids. Choose water instead of sweet/sugary beverages.
Eat a well-balanced diet.¬† Choose more fruits and vegetables.

hr.p: It is important to get enough sleep every day.¬† Set regular bed and wake-up times. Try to stick to your sleep schedule, within an hour or two, even on weekends.

ul.li: Try to get at least 60 minutes of physical activity each day.
Limit TV, computer, and video game time ‚Äì be active instead.
